Assessment.QuestionText: Which of the following statements about custom controls and their types are true and which statements are false?

Options.Option: Custom controls allow you to create reusable controls.
User-defined validation allows you to define the type of validation the user can perform.
A composite control allows you to create a control by inheriting from any standard control.
Customized design allows you to specify the appearance of standard controls on the custom control.
An extended control allows you to create a control by inheriting from the <font face = "courier new">Control</font> class.

Assessment.CorrectFeedback: Yes, that's correct! You get one point for your response.
Assessment.incorrectFeedback: No, that's incorrect. The correct selections are: (A)-(True), (B)-(True), (C)-(False), (D)-(True), and (E)-(False).
